result.execSummary:
The defendant DeVaughn J Crockett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Seek and maintain full time employment.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.

Any counseling needs or treatment to be determined.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. DeVaughn J Crockett

records.addlTxt: Received & Filed, Original PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (12 pages) commencing 07/06/2015 by Court Reporter Rose Roderick.
Case converted per Court reporter request

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Parties stipulate to changing date of noncompliance to 4/7/15 on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 25 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 6 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 13 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 12 MONTHS/YEARS.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 16 MONTHS.  Conditions of probation include:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-Any counseling needs or treatment to be determined.
-Seek and maintain full-time employment.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.

Defendant DeVaughn J Crockett in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of no contest.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated July 2, 2015 received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant DeVaughn J Crockett in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is requesting a plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant DeVaughn J Crockett in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Additional discovery to be turned over to defense.  Case set for pretrial on 6-15-2015 at 8:15.

Defendant DeVaughn J Crockett in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Ronald Dague for Michael Thurston for appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Arraignment scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/13/15.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant DeVaughn J Crockett in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant DeVaughn J Crockett in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
